Data: 6.20pm Toss Aaron Finch has won the toss and Australia will bat first. Finch says the wicket is good so they want to put runs on the board. One change for Australia with Starc replacing Behrendorff. India captain Virat Kohli says he was happy to bowl first. India are unchanged again.
Bhuvneshwar to Short, 1 run good length on middle, no swing, turns this nicely through forward square, the man in the deep runs around, they think about two but it's not on
Bhuvneshwar to Finch, no run sharp inswinger, good length, hits the pad, big appeal from Pant, but not much interest elsewhere, not out, going way down
Bhuvneshwar to Finch, 1 run good length outside off, mistimed drive runs slowly to mid off and they run an easy one as mid off is deep on the circle
Bhuvneshwar to Short, FOUR runs crunched on the up through extra cover! Good length angling across but well wide and he throws the hands through this and picks the gap at extra cover. it races away
Bhuvneshwar to Short, 1 run good length, middle and leg, tucked through square leg to the sweeper
Bhuvneshwar to Finch, 1 leg bye good length, nipping back, hits him on the pad, big appeal, not out, outside the line, it runs to a vacant gully and they run a leg bye
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, no run 125kph, beaten, good length nipping across, he prods forward and it goes past the edge, but it bounced short of Pant
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, FOUR runs 129kph, cracking pull shot! Fractionally too short and Finch pounces, he thumped this so hard through midwicket. It thumped into the rope
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, 1 wide swinging a touch down the leg side, he misses the glance, definitely a wide
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, 2 runs 127kph, good length outside off, he punches wide of mid off on the up, nicely timed, didn't overhit it, gets a couple
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, 1 wide swinging way down leg, Finch is frustrated his head falls over but it's a wide and he gets another ball
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, no run good length, fourth stump line, punched to cover

Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, no run 129kph, driven nicely on the up straight to cover, Finch walked down the track, Kohli fired at the striker's end and hit, there's a review for run out. Finch got his bat back easily
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, no run short ball outside off, Finch tries to pull hard but is through the shot and gets a bottom edge that bounces to Pant
Bhuvneshwar to Short, FOUR runs smashed down the ground straight over the umpire's head! This was 129kph in the slot and he pounded this flat and hard back at the sightscreen
Bhuvneshwar to Short, no run half-volley outside off, driven with a check drive straight to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Short, no run shorter length, of off stump, he stands up and defends back to the bowler
Bhuvneshwar to Short, no run 120kph, shorter length on off, he punches off the back foot to cover and Kohli makes a rolling save
Bhuvneshwar to Short, no run 133kph, good length across him outside off, gets a thick edge that flies along the ground to short third man
Bhuvneshwar to Short, 1 run short into the hip, he pulls nicely but straight to the man in the deep on the rope on the bounce
Bumrah to Short, FOUR runs short outside off, just enough width and he cuts beautifully past point! This wasn't that wide but he created the room and placed it perfectly
Bumrah to Short, no run beaten trying to cut again. This was not as short and closer to off
Bumrah to Short, 1 run slower ball, good length on off, he defends towards point and they pinch one on Rahul
Bumrah to Finch, no run 141kph, good length outside off, he drives on the up to cover
Bumrah to Finch, 1 run 139kph, good length angling into off, he works with the angle square of midwicket
Bumrah to Short, 1 run 139kph, very full, driven off the bottom of the bat and it rolls slowly to mid off and they run well
Khaleel Ahmed to Short, 1 leg bye 133kph, short into the thigh, he tried to whip, it runs off thigh just away into the leg side and they take an extra
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, FOUR runs 135kph, short ball, and he pounces and hammers a pull shot through square leg! He got up with the bounce and rolled the wrists. Cracking shot
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, 2 runs 114kph slower ball, length, he swipes this cross bat high over midwicket, mis timed but it falls well safe and deep midwicket comes around
Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, 1 run good length outside off, tried to loft over the off side, gets a thick inside edge onto pad, and it rolls into the off side for one
Khaleel Ahmed to Short, 1 run 134kph, short ball, chest high and he smashes a pull shot straight to the fielder on the rop at deep square

Khaleel Ahmed to Finch, FOUR runs driven magnificently wide of mid off! 117kph slower ball floated up outside off, he picked it, held his shape, and eased his hands through it, it was hit in the air but right in the gap between cover and mid off and flew to the rope
Bumrah to Short, 1 run 116kph, slower ball, bunted towards mid on
Bumrah to Finch, 1 run angled down leg and he tucks this with the angle down to fine leg
Bumrah to Short, 1 run 123kph, on the hip, he plays the pull with the one knee up, picks out the man at short fine but he misfields and allows a single
Bumrah to Finch, 1 run 144kph, he defends a good length and pushes this to cover-point and they pinch a tight one, there is a shy from Krunal at the non-strikers but he was home
Bumrah to Short, no run good length outside off, he drives on the up straight to cover
Bumrah to Short, FOUR runs full toss and square driven past point! A rare mistake from Bumrah. This was a wide full toss and Short just had to place it past point and it flies to the fence
Kuldeep to Finch, no run tries to sweep hit on the pad, huge appeal, not out. It was outside the line, not much turn
Kuldeep to Finch, 1 run floated up, leg break, he skips down to the pinch and whips with the turn to deep midwicket
Kuldeep to Short, no run tossed up, 79kph, outside off, mistimes a drive to cover
Kuldeep to Short, no run slower, good length, he's down and pushing back to the bowler
Kuldeep to Short, 2 runs wrong un, short outside off, he's back and crunching a cut shot, and Rahul misfields on the circle, they get two to the man in the deep
Kuldeep to Short, no run shorter, spinner way wide of off, he reaches to cut but misses, not called a wide, it was tight
Krunal to Finch, 1 run dropped at long on! Toss up outside off, he launches this high and gets under it, it goes miles up, Rohit camps under it and drops it. He dropped with his hands below his waist
Krunal to Short, 1 run shorter on middle, he's back and tucking this through midwicket
Krunal to Finch, 1 run shorter on middle and leg, 96kph, he's back and tucking this through square leg

Krunal to Short, FOUR runs shorter and pushed through outside off, cut hard to backward point and Bumrah misfields and it runs away for four! He should've stopped that. It just spun away from his hands
Krunal to Short, 1 run shorter length, he pulls hard to deep midwicket
Krunal to Finch, FOUR runs backs away, it's darted into leg, but short enough, he cuts past point and it beats the man at deep cover running around!
Kuldeep to Short, 1 run tossed up outside off, he square drives hard to deep cover-point
Kuldeep to Finch, 2 wide this is spinning down leg, Pant can't glove it and they run another extra
Kuldeep to Short, 1 bye top spinner, he tried to cut close to off, misses and Pant doesn't glove it again, it rolls away

Kuldeep to Finch, OUT top edged sweep caught at short fine! Krunal hangs on to this simple chance! This was a leg break on leg stump, he tries to sweep, a bit of extra bounce catches the top edge, it balloons to short fine and straight to Krunal, no chance he could drop that
Kuldeep to Maxwell, 1 wide pitching outside leg, spinning way down leg for a wide
Kuldeep to Maxwell, no run shorter on middle and leg, he tries to give room but bunts it back to the bowler
Kuldeep to Maxwell, FOUR runs wrong un, he drives and times this so well past cover! What a shot. It beats the man at deep long off

Kuldeep to Maxwell, no run given out LBW! Maxwell reviews after a long discussion with Short. It pitches on middle, he tries to whip to leg, it beats the inside edge. Definitely no bat. Ball tracking says it pitched in line, and spinning down leg! Missing leg. Maxwell survives. Great review.

Krunal to Short, OUT LBW! Again a long discussion and Short reviews! He tried to sweep, Krunal from around the wicket, it pitched in line, no bat involved. Ball tracking says it was in line, hit in line and was hitting! They lose the review this time. That was plumb.

Krunal to McDermott, OUT LBW! Given out sweeping! He's on a hat-trick! First ball sweep shot, this was tossed up outside off from around the wicket, pitches outside, he tries to sweep, it slides on and hits the back leg, and Gerard Abood says it hit in line with off!
Krunal to Carey, 1 run around the wicket, pitching on middle, he turns this with the spin to square leg
Krunal to Maxwell, 1 run tossed up outside off, he pushes off the front foot to cover
Krunal to Carey, 1 run shorter length, he's back and punching to long off
Krunal to Maxwell, no run beaten this spins sharply past the edge as he drives
Kuldeep to Carey, 1 run a tad short, making him reach outside the off stump. Carey chops it in front of point
Kuldeep to Maxwell, no run loops it up onto off stump, Maxwell drives to extra cover

Kuldeep to Maxwell, no run seems like a top spinner, going through flat on off stump and not spinning a great deal. Maxwell goes back, perhaps wondering if he can cut it, but then has to block down the pitch
Kuldeep to Maxwell, no run good length, spinning into him, Maxwell tries to pull, but it doesn't rise as much as he wants
Kuldeep to Maxwell, 1 run hits to long off. Probably picks the googly
Kuldeep to Carey, 1 run loads up a big old sweep, dragging a tossed up ball from way outside off away to deep square leg
Khaleel Ahmed to Carey, no run goes short, the ball rising up to his chest. Carey gets up on tiptoe and nudges it to short midwicket
Khaleel Ahmed to Carey, no run looks for the clip through midwicket again, but he's underestimating Khaleel's bounce. In the end, the ball lobs off his thigh and into Khaleel's followthrough
Khaleel Ahmed to Carey, 1 run helps the back of a length delivery on off stump away to deep square leg. Short-arm pull done right

Khaleel Ahmed to Maxwell, FOUR runs top-edge! It can happen, with the left-armer's bouncer going across the right-hander, and him going hard at a ball rising above his shoulder. Not easy to get on top of it to muscle it through leg. But you do have every chance of pinging a boundary right behind you
Khaleel Ahmed to Maxwell, no run goes for the pull, but here, Khaleel is able to sneak under the bat and through to the keeper
Khaleel Ahmed to Maxwell, 1 run shortish and outside off, dabs it in front of point
Kuldeep to Maxwell, 1 run seam-up delivery, I think, on a good length on off stump. And Maxwell knocks it back to long-on
Kuldeep to Carey, 2 runs that's beautiful work from Carey. Waits for the tossed up slower ball to arrive and then hits it smoothly over the field at cover.
Kuldeep to Carey, no run quicker delivery, hoping to catch the batsman cutting just because the length is short. But Carey is alive to the threat it poses to the stumps and deflects the ball to point
Kuldeep to Carey, 1 run reaches out in front of him to sweep a well tossed up delivery to deep square leg. Lovely variations in flight from Kuldeep
Kuldeep to Maxwell, no run tries to make room to crash the ball through the covers, but Kuldeep follows him, and bowls so very slow too, refusing an antsy batsman any pace to work with
Kuldeep to Maxwell, 1 run doesn't pick the googly this time as a good length ball on middle and leg spins away and takes the leading edge as he tries to flick it

Krunal to Maxwell, OUT taken at long-on! Maxwell clears his front leg and tries to launch the ball into orbit. And really, this ball is there to be hit, pitched short of a length and not even pretending as if it'd turn. The batsman makes room, hits as hard as he can, but he can't clear the straight field. Simple catch to Rohit, who makes up for the earlier drop
Krunal to Carey, 1 run sweeps the fuller delivery outside off to deep midwicket
Krunal to Lynn, 1 run whips the flatter delivery on middle through midwicket
Krunal to Carey, FOUR runs over cover! Insane timing. Carey does nothing more than extend his hands, and a straight bat. And the full toss outside off just disappears to the boundary
Krunal to Carey, 1 run works it down to long-on, dragging it from outside off
Krunal to Lynn, 1 run good length on off stump, taps to point, and runs
Khaleel Ahmed to Lynn, 1 wide back of a length and strays too far outside off for the umpire's liking
Khaleel Ahmed to Lynn, 1 run goes round the wicket for a length ball outside off, Lynn slides it away to deep point
Khaleel Ahmed to Carey, no run full on off stump, Carey dinks it down the pitch and Khaleel doesn't let it go past him on his left
Khaleel Ahmed to Carey, FOUR runs low full toss outside off, steers it to the boundary at cover. Simple timing again. Has a solid base. Keeps his eye on the ball. Plays as it's said in the text book
Khaleel Ahmed to Carey, 1 run hacks away a back of a length delivery from outside off to deep midwicket
Khaleel Ahmed to Lynn, no run looks like the slower ball, banged into the middle of the pitch. The 118 kph delivery is pushed to extra cover
Khaleel Ahmed to Lynn, 1 wide offcutter again, but in trying to play hide and seek with Lynn, he slants this ball way too wide outside off

Khaleel Ahmed to Lynn, 1 run gets into the pull shot a little too early and only gets a toe-end on this short ball outside off. Good over from the left-arm quick. Excellent plan to change the pace and pull his length back against the big-hitting Lynn. Denies him that big, baseball swing
Krunal to Lynn, 2 runs full and outside off, Lynn drives to the left of long-off and pinches a second run
Krunal to Lynn, 1 wide slips down leg as Lynn misses his sweep shot, the bat coming down a little too late to catch up with the ball
Krunal to Lynn, 1 run pushes the flatter delivery on leg stump to long-on

Krunal to Carey, FOUR runs beautiful shot, over cover! The left-armer coming round the wicket drifts the ball across the left-hander. And he just plants his foot forward and extends the arms. Breathtaking clarity.
Krunal to Carey, FOUR runs knows the bowler will go short and wicket to wicket, so he is ready with a reverse swat, taking the ball off middle stump and smuggling it to the third man boundary

Krunal to Carey, OUT finds deep midwicket! It's the tossed up delivery. It's on middle. It's there for the sweep shot and Carey's been timing them like nobody's business. Except here, as well as he hits it, he can only find Kohli on the boundary
Krunal to Stoinis, 1 run nudges it through vacant square leg

Bhuvneshwar to Stoinis, 1 run takes the pace off and pitches it short as well. Stoinis can't adjust to the lack of pace. And he doesn't have any room to free the arms. Tries to flick, but it lobs off his body towards where silly point would have been
Bhuvneshwar to Lynn, 1 run looks like a legcutter, which Lynn smashes it deep point. Stands tall and flat bats it with venom
Bhuvneshwar to Stoinis, 1 run back of a length on off stump, Stoinis gets an outside edge to point

Bhuvneshwar to Lynn, FOUR runs lashes it to the point boundary. Decent plan to bowl slow at a hard-hitter of the ball. So too is the length - short on these big Aussie grounds can be useful - but there is too much room on it and Lynn takes full toll
Bhuvneshwar to Lynn, 1 run targets the base of off stump, Lynn skews it away for a single at long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Stoinis, 1 run holds his shape, even though it seems like he only just picks the slower ball, and taps it to the right of Bhuvi for a single
Bumrah to Stoinis, 2 runs back of a length and outside off, Stoinis punches to the sweeper

Bumrah to Stoinis, OUT mix-up, direct hit, Lynn's gone. Oooh, this is silly, silly stuff. Stoinis starts it all by dabbing the ball gently towards point and wants a single. Lynn isn't keen on it at first but then just as he commits to it, Stoinis is haring back into his crease, leaving him no choice but to race back to the bowler's end. But Bumrah is on the balll, he takes aim and he throws down the stumps. Super stuff
Bumrah to Stoinis, no run another slower ball, the offcutter kicking up off the pitch and unsettling Stoinis, who nicks the ball almost onto his stumps
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run short and outside off, he slaps it to deep point
Bumrah to Coulter-Nile, 1 run nails the yorker on middle and Coulter-Nile is awake to it's considerable threat. Single towards mid-on
Bumrah to Stoinis, FOUR runs slices the full toss on and around off stump to the point boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Coulter-Nile, 2 runs yorker on middle and leg, Coulter-Nile works it to deep midwicket
Bhuvneshwar to Coulter-Nile, 1 run looks for the blockhole again, Coulter-Nile hits it down the ground to long-on
Bhuvneshwar to Stoinis, 1 run good length and outside off - but there's no pace in it. Stoinis blocks to point for a single
Bhuvneshwar to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs legcutter flies away off the outside edge. Tiny bit of room for Coulter-Nile to free the arms and he latches onto it well enough to get four over point
Bhuvneshwar to Coulter-Nile, no run pin-point yorker on off stump and Coulter-Nile is only just able to dig it out

Bhuvneshwar to Coulter-Nile, FOUR runs carves the length ball to the left of long-off. Bhuvi misses his mark and Coulter-Nile clears his front leg and sends it racing away across the SCG turf, singeing the grass
Bumrah to Stoinis, FOUR runs bouncer! Hoicks it away over midwicket! And then looks at the bottom of the bat! Honestly, if it travels the distance on an Aussie ground, that bat must be magic
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 run sends it to long-on
Bumrah to Coulter-Nile, 1 run slower ball outside off, Coulter-Nile prepares to flat bat it over the bowler's head but the lack of pace makes him drag it to long-on
Bumrah to Stoinis, 2 runs back of a length slower ball targeting the wide line, Stoinis thumps it down the ground to long-off

Bumrah to Stoinis, 2 runs heaves the short ball out to long-on! They want a second run. It's risky. Coulter-Nile dives. Has he made it? The third umpire needs to check this Yes! He has. And it's all because of a sensational dive! Full-length. Perfectly timed. And he gets to his crease in the time it takes for Bumrah to collect the ball and break the stumps
Bumrah to Stoinis, 1 wide loses his shape as he goes for a slog and the dipping slower ball outside off wanders away to the keeper
Bumrah to Stoinis, FOUR runs goes for the pull, gets an inside edge, and slips away to the left of the diving fine leg fielder. Hm, 164 then, that's a pretty decent total all considered.
Meanwhile, in the Pro Kabaddi League, pre-tournament favourites Bengal Warriors are in danger of missing out on the playoffs because of their shaky defence. Read more here

8.30 pm Australia's openers set up the launchpad with a fifty partnership. But then Krunal Pandya, who was hit for 12 in his first over, rallied well to finish with four wickets, the best figures by a spinner in a T20I in Australia. At that point, with the spinners going well, it seemed like Australia would struggle to put up a score, and they were also hiding Chris Lynn down the order, perhaps to prevent him from facing Kuldeep and Krunal.
8.40pm Here we go. The Australians are about to head out onto the ground. Rohit and Shikhar won't be far behind. Rohit Sharma will face the first ball from Mitchell Starc.
Starc to Rohit Sharma, 1 run 142kph, good length, hint of swing in to off, runs off the edge along the ground to third man
Starc to S Dhawan, no run 146kph, good length outside off, he tried to launch this with a cross bat, chops it off the bottom edge into the pitch
Starc to S Dhawan, 1 run 146kph, back of a length just outside, he waits and runs it off the open blade to third man
Starc to Rohit Sharma, 1 run 146kph, inswinging yorker, he jams the bat down and squeezes it behind square, just got the bat down in time!
Starc to S Dhawan, no run 142kph, bouncer, this flies very high, Dhawan sways under, it's not called wide
Starc to S Dhawan, no run 145kph, good length angled into middle, he works this with the angle to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs angled down leg, he picks this up and flicks it up and over short fine! Great shot
Coulter-Nile to Rohit Sharma, 1 run full outswinger outside off, pitching on the popping crease, he slices it through the gully
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run 138kph, good length into leg stump, cramping him, he works to square midwicket
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run 125kph slower ball, good length on middle, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run good length outside off, he drags it off the bottom half of the bat to midwicket
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, FOUR runs steps back and across early and pulls behind square! Great batting, he moved early, created the shorter length and pulled it fine of the man at deep square
Starc to Rohit Sharma, 1 run good length on off, he defends with soft hands close into the off side, and an easy one is run. Great batting
Starc to S Dhawan, 1 wide 144kph, swinging wide of off, he flashes and misses but it's called wide by Paul Wilson
Starc to S Dhawan, 2 runs full into off, he drives inside out wide of mid off, Tye goes with the one hand and misfields, he allows a couple
Starc to S Dhawan, no run 145kph, back of a length into middle, he turns it with the angle to midwicket
Starc to S Dhawan, no run 145kph, tailing into the pads, full, he misses out trying to whip it away, it was going way down leg so no shout for LBW
Starc to S Dhawan, no run 139kph bouncer, he tries to pull hard but it comes off a touch slower than he expected
Starc to S Dhawan, FOUR runs cracking off drive! This was a half-volley and he leaned into the drive and placed it perfectly past mid off
Coulter-Nile to Rohit Sharma, 1 wide angled down the leg side and rightly called wide
Coulter-Nile to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs short into the hip and he pulls with the angle up and over fine leg into the crowd! What a shot. Too easy for Sharma
Coulter-Nile to Rohit Sharma, 1 run 137kph, good length, fourth stump, he defends with soft hands running into the gully
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, no run 126kph, good length, middle and leg, he defends on the front foot
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, 2 runs 116kph, slower ball bouncer, he waits and pulls to deep square leg
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, SIX runs slower ball, back of a length, he hammers a slog sweep over deep midwicket into the crowd again! Wow!
Coulter-Nile to S Dhawan, FOUR runs slower ball again and driven on the up straight of cover! Superb batting from Shikhar Dhawan. He has clobbered this on the rise into the gap
Stoinis to Rohit Sharma, no run 128kph, good length into leg stump, he turns neatly off the front foot to midwicket
Stoinis to Rohit Sharma, SIX runs crunch! A front foot pull over long on! Just a fraction short at 126kph, Rohit read it and flat batted this over long on and it goes all the way
Stoinis to Rohit Sharma, 1 run 127kph, good length on off, he turns with soft hands to square leg for a single
Stoinis to S Dhawan, 1 wide slower ball full toss that slipped out way wide. It didn't land on the pitch

Stoinis to S Dhawan, SIX runs launched over square leg way back into the stands! My goodness! Again he drops short on the hip and he massacres this pull shot and it goes way, way, way back into the crowd!
Stoinis to S Dhawan, FOUR runs 102kph slower ball, good length, he sits waits and slaps it back over the bowler's head, three bounces over the rope!

Stoinis to S Dhawan, FOUR runs pulled over mid on and it lands just short of the rope! Wow! This was 129kph, short and way wide, he stands up and hammers a pull flat and straight over mid on. It was only metres short of another six!
Starc to Rohit Sharma, 1 run 129kph, good length slower ball on off, he defends with soft hands into the off side for a simple one
Starc to S Dhawan, FOUR runs driven through cover! 128kph slower ball, half-volley, he picks it, waits and places this inside out past cover and it flies to the rope. What batting this is
Starc to Kohli, no run full angled across, he is cautious, playing a text book defensive push to cover
Starc to Kohli, no run shorter length, on middle and leg, he jumps back in defence into cover
Starc to Kohli, no run 146kph, good length on leg, he works it to midwicket
Zampa to Rohit Sharma, no run tossed up leg break, very full, driven back to the bowler
Zampa to Rohit Sharma, no run shorter and wider, it skids on, he tries to late cut but misses
Zampa to Rohit Sharma, no run fired through, angled down leg, he tried to pull and slips over as it hits the pad. There's an appeal but it's not out
Zampa to Rohit Sharma, no run flipper, fired into off, he defends on the front foot
Zampa to Rahul, no run tossed up outside off, he drives straight to cover
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 2 runs 135kph, good length, he walks a pace down to the line and whips this sumptuously wide of mid on for two. What a way to get off the mark!
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run 132kph, short ball, he's pulling but gets it off the toes of the bat and rolls it around to deep fine leg
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, no run 136kph, good length, fourth stump line, checks a drive to cover

Coulter-Nile to Rahul, SIX runs pulled over deep square! 132kph, back of a length, he picked up the length so quick, pulled it off the bottom of the bat but he hit it hard enough to sail high over the man in the deep at square leg!
Coulter-Nile to Rahul, 1 run pushed on the front foot slowly to mid off and they run well to pinch one
Coulter-Nile to Kohli, 1 run 137kph, fuller length, he drives nicely to deep cover-point
Maxwell to Kohli, no run 85kph, around the wicket, drifting to middle, he defends on the front foot
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run shorter length on leg, he whips this nicely to deep square leg
Maxwell to Rahul, no run he pushes this through to off, he's back and defending
Maxwell to Rahul, 1 run shorter on leg, he's back and working through square leg to the sweeper
Maxwell to Kohli, no run flighted slower and fuller, he drives straight to cover
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run 95kph, good length on off, he's back and pushing this to midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, 2 runs drifting outside leg, on the front foot he works this through square leg and Kohli immediately calls two, great running. He is so good at that
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run flighted outside off, a slog sweep flat along the ground to deep long on
Zampa to Rahul, 2 wide fired full down leg, Carey can't glove the half-volley, they get another run on top
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run flatter outside off, deft late cut to fine short third man
Zampa to Rahul, no run wrong un, nicely pitched turning into off, he defends into the off side
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run shorter length on off, 92kph, he's back and pushing it to long on
Zampa to Kohli, FOUR runs short and wide and Kohli pounces, cuts this hard and places past point! Great stroke from Kohli
Maxwell to Rahul, 1 run shuffles across with Maxwell going across him from round the wicket, and the good length ball on off stump is nudged through midwicket
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run leans forward as he get to the pitch of the offbreak on leg stump and works it through midwicket
Maxwell to Rahul, no run goes for the reverse sweep, but with Maxwell pulling his length back, he's unable to make any contact
Maxwell to Rahul, no run pushes it through on middle and leg, Rahul works it to the right of the bowler
Maxwell to Rahul, no run tosses it up on off stump, Rahul knocks it back at the bowler, unable to find the single he wants
Maxwell to Rahul, 1 run ticks it past the right of Maxwell, even with him diving full-length to his right
Zampa to Rahul, no run premeditates a reverse sweep and that allows the bowler to change his line, bowling onto leg stump to deny hitting room.
Zampa to Rahul, no run comes down the pitch but Zampa gets the ball to dip in time and Rahul can only push it down the pitch
Zampa to Rahul, 1 run whips it through midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, 2 runs stays back in his crease against the googly, picking the variation, waiting for it to turn into him, and them flicks it sweetly to deep midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, 3 runs gorgeous late cut but even still, it should only have been a single. Lynn at short third man mistimes his dive and gives away a couple more

Zampa to Rahul, 1 run thinks about coming down the pitch but Zampa's flat trajectory and his excellent line around off stump disallows Rahul any access to his power game. Single through cover off an ugly slice
Maxwell to Rahul, no run shortish and outside off, from round the wicket, Rahul punches to cover
Maxwell to Rahul, 1 run steps out to drive a length ball going across him to long-off

Maxwell to Kohli, 2 runs mis-hits it over point! Kohli is trying to make room, trying to one-up Maxwell who has been trying to deny that. The ball drifts away from him just enough to make him lose his shape
Maxwell to Kohli, 2 runs turns the length ball on middle through square leg
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run shortish and outside off, he stands tall and pulls it through midwicket
Tye to Karthik, no run good length on off stump, blocks to cover and runs
Tye to Karthik, no run lbw appeal but the fuller delivery is slanted into the pads and would have slipped down past the stumps as DK misses the flick
Tye to Karthik, no run
Tye to Karthik, no run back of a length on off stump, Karhik keeps it out
Tye to Karthik, 1 run shortsh on middle and leg, they secure a single through midwicket
Zampa to Karthik, 1 run works it away straight of midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run picks the googly as he stays back and flicks the quicker delivery through midwicket
Zampa to Karthik, 1 run loops it up on middle, Karthik turns it to deep midwicket
Zampa to Kohli, no run goes wide of the crease to ensure the ball slants into Kohli, dipping at the last second to beat Kohli on the flick
Zampa to Kohli, 1 run short and outside off, Kohli pulls it to long-on
Zampa to Karthik, no run steps out but he ends up too close to the ball, yorking himself as he tries to drive to cover
Tye to Kohli, 1 wide Kohli yells at himself after he fails to make contact with a length ball wandering away down leg
Tye to Kohli, no run comes down the pitch, only to inside edge the back of a length ball that denies him the room he wants
Tye to Kohli, FOUR runs lashes it over point. Excellent work from Kohli, getting on top of the ball, waiting on it so he can get the gap behind point
Tye to Kohli, SIX runs times it perfectly - both the step down the pitch and the bat swing that comes down and goes straight through the line of the ball. Outstanding shot over long-off
Tye to Kohli, no run slower ball, and that lack of pace is useful in deceiving Kohli, as he plays the flick and misses
Tye to Kohli, 1 run back of a length and outside off, Kohli taps it behind point
Tye to Karthik, no run opens the face against a length ball on off stump, but he finds point
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run full on middle, Kohli tucks it through midwicket
Maxwell to Karthik, 1 run sweeps the loopy delivery on off stump away to backward square leg on the boundary

Maxwell to Kohli, SIX runs launches it over deep midwicket! Spectacular hit, coming down the track, and even though he isn't to the pitch of the ball, he holds his balance and that's where he gets all that power from
Maxwell to Kohli, 1 run works it through midwicket, along the ground this time

Maxwell to Karthik, 2 runs run-out chance at the non-strikers. Karthik nudges it to the right of Maxwell and thinks there's a straightforward single there. But Maxwell hares across, grabs it with his right hand, takes aim, but misses the target
Maxwell to Karthik, 2 runs goes for the reverse scoop, and though he only makes contact with the glove, it's enough to get a couple right over the keeper's head
Tye to Kohli, 2 runs taps it into the vacant midwicket region, always looking for two, and getting it in the end
Tye to Kohli, 1 run gets up with the short ball outside off and swats it to deep point
Tye to Karthik, 1 run comes down the pitch and drives the full delivery tailing into him to mid-off
Tye to Kohli, 1 run mis-hit behind square leg, but it brings up his fifty. The slower short ball has him playing a touch too early
Tye to Karthik, SIX runs so much height on it! And it's on the second tier. Mistake from the bowler, going short, the ball sitting up to be pulled to oblivion
Tye to Karthik, no run appeal for a catch off the boot. But the umpire Abood says no. Decent ball though, tailing in late, cramping Kathik who was charging down the pitch again
Starc to Kohli, 2 runs hustles it away towards the deep midwicket boundary as Starc bowls a full one on off stump from round the wicket
Starc to Kohli, 1 leg bye 141 kph, tries to whip a back of a length ball angled into his thighs, but he's into the shot a tiny bit early and the ball lobs off his thigh

Starc to Karthik, FOUR runs spears it to the point boundary! It's not quite the yorker Starc is looking for outside off. But it is exactly what DK is ready for. Stays balanced at the crease. And more importantly, low, as well and opens the face of the bat. Lovely stuff
Starc to Karthik, 1 run whip of the wrists sending the fuller delivery looking for the middle stump away through square leg
Starc to Kohli, 1 run pulls the short ball from outside off to deep square leg
Starc to Karthik, 2 runs walks across outside off and ends up too far away from the short ball outside leg. In the end, he just about gets to it with a pull through square leg
Tye to Kohli, no run beats him with a slower ball that Kohli swings across the line and misses completely
Tye to Kohli, no run is that not a wide, asks Kohli, after he doesn't make contact with another short, slower ball outside off
Tye to Kohli, FOUR runs thumps it down the ground. It's a half-volley, in Kohli's swinging arc, and he hammers it away. He's pumped. He's punching the air. He's sensing the series going level
Tye to Kohli, FOUR runs swings it out to the vacant areas around midwicket and celebrates with arms aloft. India level the series

10.15 pm This chase was put to bed in the first five overs, with Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan running amok. Australia couldn't hit a single six today, but those two were smoking every other ball out of the ground. But Mitchell Starc, playing his first T20I in two years - his first at home in four - got that first wicket with his searing pace. That strike helped his team-mates settle down and take the game deep. In the end though, as disc
"I thought with the ball we were more professional today. I thought it was 180 type of wicket. Those 15 runs less were crucial. A level series is a great show of how the teams have played."
"The best part of team India is they back all of the players whether you are doing well or poorly."
On behalf of Alagappan Muthu and all the team it's goodbye from the SCG.

That concludes this T20 series. India clearly the better side tonight and probably unlucky with the weather in Melbourne not to win the series 2-1. Now we move on to the Test matches. India play a tour game against the Cricket Australia XI starting on Wednesday at the SCG. The Australian Test squad with the exception of Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood will play in Shield matches starting on Monday and Tuesday. The first Test
India won by 6 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Krunal Pandya, INDIA
